column15:
A power degradation occurred in the interconnection between 
Rack 56 and Rack 51 at neuCentrIX Karet, Jakarta. 
Replaced the cross-connect cable with a new one.
column16:
The issue has been permanently resolved, and we will closely 
monitor.

column15:
There was a down voltage in PLN which resulted in a broken 
MCB in TS Bahomahoni.
column16:
1. Checking the at the site 
2. Make repairs to the main PLN MCB.
column17: #20250000582 | Baoshuo (CrossNet) | Intermittent | BTIIG-Morowali | Baoshuo report bahwa sempat mengakami disconnect pada 04/06/2025 18:21 WIB dan sudah kembali normal pada 18:38 WIB | Dari hasil pengecekan ke CN bahwa mereka sempat detect FO ke arah TS bahomahoni intermitten dikarenakan  ada masalah electrical di TS bahomahoni | Update dari CN bahwa mereka ingin instalasi perangkat UPS di TS Bahomani | Keep update | FU RFO | RFO available | Draft IR lalu validasi ke internal | CLOSED

column15:
After a thorough check with the network team, we did not find any 
issue within the internal network segment. However, at that time, 
there was a flap on the upstream provider’s internal backbone 
between Jakarta and Singapore. This caused a route reset of the 
prefixes on their router.
column16: Optimize the JKT-Singapore backbone.
column17: #20250000584 | OWS (ABH-ISPL) | Destination Unreachable | AB22025 – Multiple Services | OWS report bahwa semua prefixnya di JKT inaccessible dan meminta untuk di check | Sudah di open ticket ke ISPL | Terlihat Outbound Vlan 766 ISPL mengalami penurunan pada periode yang sama | Update dari ISPL suspect impact dari Flappingnya backbone JKT<>SG | Saat ini sedang di make sure untuk spesific issuenya | RFO Available | FU validasi RFO ke internal | CLOSED

column15:
The packet loss was caused by congestion on the upstream path 
after the primary upstream experienced an outage.
column16:
Optimized the network by redistributing traffic to alternative 
upstream links to prevent a recurrence of this issue.

column15: There was a PLN electricity outage in the TS bahomahoni area.
column16:

then reverted back after PLN power was restored.

column15:
Based on confirmation from ICON, there was a fiber optic (FO) cut 
on their POP segment. This caused the tunnel between the Jakarta 
distribution router and the CPE at the site to go down.
column16:
1. ICON team resolved the fiber cut.
2. At 5 PM ABH team went onsite to reconnect the link to the 
MikroTik after the customer temporarily bypassed the link around 
10:30 AM.

column15:
The metro link between Jakarta and the Donlim site went down 
due to a backbone trunk issue at the provider's PoP in Cyber1, 
caused by an SFP module failure.
column16:
Onsite engineers promptly replaced the faulty SFP module after 
get request from their NOC.

column15:
Based on traceroute and traceback analysis submitted during the 
investigation, there was no indication of packet loss or abnormal 
behavior within the ABH network segment. - Packet loss was 
observed starting from Hop 8 to Hop 9, where the network path 
transitioned through the TATA segment.
column16:
There is no action taken from Abhinawa side, packet loss normal 
after issue was done by TATA.

column15: The Destination Unreachable event was caused by a physical link issue at the supplier's end, specifically a faulty core segment between the Edge router and APJII. This disruption coincided with an installation activity of a new tray at the APJII data center, which interfered with core connectivity and led to routing failures
column16: Replaced fiber cable

column15:
1. Fiber cut at section Secang-Bedono, Purwodadi-SNSolo, Rengas 
bendung-Cikampek Kota. 

2. All LACP ports on the switch at Cyber1 DC experienced a 
simultaneous reset/reinitialization. No specific logs were found, 
and the device showed no signs of restart, PFE reset, power cycle 
issue, or protocol restart. System resources such as CPU, RAM, and 
temperature were also stable. Based on system behavior and the 
absence of critical logs, it is suspected that the issue was caused 
by a software bug in JunOS version 22.2R3-S2.8, which may trigger 
a global LACP reinitialization.
column16:
1. Reroute transmission.

2. All services were automatically restored after all LACP ports came 
back up.

to FO cut on the primary since this morning, then at 16.12 there was

column15:
There was a disruption in the IDC backbone connection to Cyber1 
due to a fiber optic (FO) cut on the primary link since morning. 
Then, at 16:12, there was also a FO cut on the secondary link. 
However, at 16:20, the primary link was successfully restored, so 
that the logical connection and BGP session were re-established.
column16: Normal after the primary Up.
